title: Singapore Cup
text:
The Singapore Cup is an annual <a href="single-elimination%20tournament">knockout</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition in Singapore.
The Singapore Cup is the major cup competition in Singapore football, and has existed since 1998. It was renamed from the <a href="1997%20Singapore%20League%20Cup">1997 Singapore League Cup</a>, which bears no relation to the current <a href="Singapore%20League%20Cup">competition of the same name</a>. In 2019, Komoco Motors became the title sponsors of the 2019 Singapore Cup. 
It is open to clubs in the <a href="Singapore%20Premier%20League">Singapore Premier League</a>. Since 2005, foreign teams from other countries in <a href="Southeast%20Asia">Southeast Asia</a> have been invited to compete in the Singapore Cup. <a href="Chonburi%20F.C.">Chonburi Province FC</a> from <a href="Thailand">Thailand</a> was the first foreign club reaching the final in 2006 (they lost 3–2 in the final to <a href="Tampines%20Rovers%20FC">Tampines Rovers</a>). In 2009, <a href="Bangkok%20Glass%20F.C.">Bangkok Glass</a> became the second foreign team to reach the final, losing it against <a href="Geylang%20International%20FC">Geylang United</a>, but they beat Tampines Rovers in 2010 to become the first foreign winners of the Singapore Cup.
